resources.string: Error, video file may be corrupted
Screen is locked\nswipe the screen to unlock
Sorry, auto-level not supported\non this device
Failed to stamp info to photo
Images will be rotated so they are automatically level (photos only) (slower to take photos, and may fail on devices with too low memory)
Applies the selected color effect to the photo
Optimise the photo for different scenes
Choose a setting to adjust the white balance
A higher value means more sensitive to light (may not work on some devices)
Set to 0 for the default exposure compensation
If set, the orientation of the device will be ignored, and the orientation of the photo/video will be with respect to the specified orientation\n%s
Use face detection instead of focus areas
Beep when timer is counting down or for repeat mode delay
Speak the countdown for timer or repeat mode delay (from 60 seconds)
Take a photo just by touching or double-tapping the preview
Pause the screen after taking a photo, with the option to share or delete the photo
Play a sound when taking a photo
Noise level sensitivity for audio (loud noise) option
Folder to save the photo/video files in
Whether to use Storage Access Framework for saving photos and videos. This should be enabled (on Android 5+) to allow saving to external SD cards.
The prefix to use for the save filenames for photos
The prefix to use for the save filenames for videos
If enabled, Open Camera will still show above any lockscreen (you\'ll still have to unlock to access Settings, Gallery etc)
Whether to auto-focus when Open Camera is started. If you have the problem of flash turning on when starting, disable this option

When recording video, the GUI will be locked to prevent accidentally stopping recording. Swipe the screen to unlock. Note that video recording will always stop if the app goes into background or the screen is blanked.
Option to rotate the preview (won\'t affect resultant photos/videos)\n%s
Display the current camera zoom level on screen (when zoomed in)
Show the -/+ buttons for zoom control
Show the slider for zoom control
Display the current ISO level. In flash auto mode, a flash symbol will also indicate when flash will fire. (Requires Camera2 API.)
Display the remaining device storage space on screen
Display the current device orientation angle on screen
Highlight color for when camera is nearly level
Display the compass direction of the device on screen
Display the current time on screen
Display the current battery level on screen

A crop guide displays a rectangle showing what the specified aspect ratio looks like - useful if you plan to crop the photo/video afterwards to a different aspect ratio. Requires WYSIWYG photo mode, or being in video mode.\n%s
Whether to display the popup \"toast\" messages
Display moving thumbnail animation when taking a photo
Display a border on the display to indicate taking a photo
If enabled, the screen won\'t switch off while the main Open Camera UI is active
Force screen display to be at maximum brightness, rather than device default
Set the image quality of saved JPEG or WebP photo images (default value is 90%%). Has no effect for PNG image format.\n%s
Store GPS location data in the photos/videos (for photos, location data can only be stored in JPEG and DNG formats)
Store GPS compass direction in the photos (JPEG format only)
If location data is enabled, only take photo/video if location data is available
Stamp photos with date and time; and also GPS info if location/direction data is enabled\n%s
Stamp photos with a custom text
Font size to use when stamping text onto photos
Font color to use when stamping text onto photos
Style to use when stamping text onto photos\n%s
Whether to save photos on a background thread (for faster operation)
Force 4K UHD video (only works on some devices)

Enable 3840x2160 resolution for video recording on back camera - this option is a hack that may allow 4K devices on 4K cameras that don\'t expose the option to 3rd party camera apps. This isn\'t guaranteed to work, please test before working.
Video stabilization reduces the shaking due to the motion of the camera in both the preview and in recorded videos
Set the approximate bitrate of videos (higher means better quality, but takes up more disk space; may cause video recording to fail if bitrate not supported)\n%s

Set the frame rate (FPS) of videos (may be approx, not guaranteed to be achieved, and may cause video recording to fail if frame rate not supported). Note that this setting is ignored for slow motion videos.\n%s
The video recording will stop after the specified duration\n%s
If the video has stopped after hitting the maximum duration (if set), this option will make the video restart, up to the specified number of times\n%s

The video recording will stop and/or restart (see option below) when the (approximate) maximum file size is reached. Note that many Android devices have a maximum file size for videos (typically around 2GB or 4GB), but this option allows setting a specific value. Note that this option can\'t be used to increase a device\'s built-in maximum.\n%s
Whether to automatically restart when the maximum file size is reached (whether the device default max file size, or user specified)
Microphone to use for recording audio\n%s
Specify mono or stereo for recording audio (stereo only supported on some devices)
If enabled, flash will switch on/off when recording video (can be used to tell camera is still recording at a distance)
Launch the Open Camera website in your browser
If you like this app, please consider making a donation to support development. You can do this by purchasing my "donation app" - click this option to open up the page for my donation app. Thanks!
Enables extra features such as manual modes for exposure, focus, white balance, along with RAW (if supported by the device), but may not work properly on all devices (will cause a restart)
Reset all Open Camera settings to default
Are you sure you want to reset all Open Camera settings to default?
Unable to save to this folder
Auto-level will automatically rotate photos so that they appear level.\n\nNote that this means images will come out a slightly lower resolution (due to the rotation and cropping that\'s required).

DNG files contain the full uncompressed and unprocessed information from your camera.

Note that some gallery apps don't recognise DNG files. DNG images can be used with specialised image editors like Snapseed or Lightroom.

Note that various processing options such as "Stamp photos" and "Auto-level" will only apply to the non-DNG (JPEG/etc) images, and not the DNG images.

HDR mode is useful for shots with a large variation in brightness. It works by taking multiple shots at different exposures, and combining them to create the final image.

Note that HDR is not suitable for scenes with fast movement, and may result in less accurate color reproduction.

Taking photos in HDR mode will be slower.
Save all images for HDR mode

If enabled, when using HDR photo mode, the three base exposure images will be saved as well as the final HDR photo. Note this will make saving slower, especially if options like \"Stamp photos\" or Auto-level are also used.
Camera permission is required to enable the camera
Storage read/write permission is required to save photos
Microphone permission is required to record video with audio, as well as use the \"Audio control\" options
Location permission is required for geotagging (storing location data in photos and videos). Location permission is also required for connecting to Bluetooth LE remote control devices.
Enable this if your device has buggy flash behaviour with Camera2 API
Number of images for exposure bracketing mode\n%s
How many stops to subtract/add for the darkest/brightest image\n%s
Whether to save original images in noise reduction mode. Note this can make saving photos much slower.\n%s
Not enough free space to record video
Stop video recording if battery level is critically low. This helps reduce the risk of videos being corrupted if your device suddenly switches off due to running out of power.
Allows faster capture of the HDR/expo shots. Disable this if your device has problems when taking photos with HDR or Expo photo modes.
Whether to mirror the resultant photos when using the front camera\n%s
This option calibrates your device\'s accelerometer, so the auto-level and on-screen level/angle options work correctly

Please place your device on a flat horizontal surface so that it is level (either in portrait or landscape orientation), and then select Calibrate.

Press Reset to remove the calibration from your device.

Press back button to cancel.
Create a subtitles (.SRT) file storing date and time; and also GPS info if location/direction data is enabled\n%s
Show the icon for taking photos and recording videos. Uncheck if you\'d rather take photos by other methods (e.g., if your device has a hardware shutter button, or using the volume keys).
Text to store in the image metadata for the "artist" tag (JPEG format only). (Leave blank for none.)
Text to store in the image metadata for the "copyright" tag (JPEG format only). (Leave blank for none.)
Algorithms to help with light flickering.\n%s
Overlay an image, to help with alignment.\n%s
No file dialog found on this device, ghost image option is not supported
Allows taking photos whilst recording videos. Disable this if there are problems with video recording with Camera2 API enabled on your device.
Enable a flat (log) profile for video mode\n%s
Whether to show on-screen audio level when recording video
Your device\'s compass needs calibrating to improve its accuracy. This can be done by moving your device in a figure of 8 motion.\n\nCurrent accuracy:
Used for GPS altitude for photo stamp and video subtitles\n%s
Whether to display information on new features and improvements when the application has updated
Algorithm that the camera driver should use for applying edge enhancement. Edge enhancement improves sharpness and details in the captured image. (This setting is ignored in NR photo mode.)\n%s

Algorithm that the camera driver should use for applying noise reduction. The noise reduction algorithm attempts to improve image quality by removing excessive noise added by the capture process, especially in dark conditions. (Note that this is not related to the Noise Reduction photo mode, and in fact this setting is ignored in NR photo mode.)\n%s
Whether to zoom in when adjusting manual focus distance\n%s
When to use a contrast enhancement algorithm for HDR. This can improve the appearance in cases where there is a very high dynamic range in the scene, and also gives a "HDR look" to the results.\n%s
Video and audio file format and codecs\n%s
Saves all of Open Camera\'s settings to a file
Restores previously saved settings. This will overwrite all current settings with the saved settings!
This option allows you to select one of the settings files that you previously saved. Be warned that selecting a file to load will overwrite all current settings!
No file dialog found on this device, option is not supported
Whether to show an on-screen icon for enabling or disabling face detection
Whether to show an on-screen icon for enabling or disabling auto-level. When auto-level is enabled, photos will be rotated so they are automatically level with the horizon.
Whether to show an on-screen icon for enabling or disabling photo stamp
Show custom text stamp photo icon
Whether to show an on-screen icon for specifying custom text to be stamped onto the photo
Show auto white balance lock icon
Whether to show an on-screen icon for locking or unlocking auto white balance
Whether to show an on-screen icon for locking or unlocking exposure
Low light mode: please hold the camera steady
Enable Bluetooth LE (BLE) remote control devices
Hint: set default brightness to minimum level before starting Open Camera.
For underwater housings, improves accuracy if correct water type is selected.
Display address if possible, in addition to GPS coords
Whether to show an on-screen icon for enabling or disabling location data (geotagging)
Whether to display histogram of the colors shown on-screen\n%s
If this option is enabled, zebra stripes will be drawn on-screen showing where the camera preview is over exposed.\n%s

If this option is enabled, highlights will be shown on in-focus edges (contours). This is primarily useful for manual focus, and can be used to help determine which regions of the image are in focus.\n%s
Which color to use for highlighting the in-focus edges\n%s
Whether to show an on-screen icon for cycling through the flash options, instead of displaying flash options on the popup menu

Whether the RAW option should also apply for expo bracketing photo mode (or for HDR mode when \"Save all images for HDR mode\" is enabled). If this option is disabled, only JPEGs will be saved in those photo modes.
Whether the RAW option should also apply for focus bracketing photo mode. If this option is disabled, only JPEGs will be saved in focus bracketing photo modes.
Whether to show an on-screen icon for cycling through the RAW modes
For panorama mode, whether to remove the wavy boundaries\n%s

To take a panorama image, hold your device in portrait orientation, and click to take a photo to start the panorama. Then rotate your device either left or right to move the centred white circle over the blue dot. After each new image is captured, keep rotating your device to cover each new blue dot that appears in turn.

Click the tick icon to save the panorama, or the cross icon to cancel.

Note that panorama photos can take time to process and save.

Whether to save original images in panorama mode. Note this will make saving panorama photos slower. Also allows the option to save an XML file which can be useful reporting problems with panorama.\n%s
Save original images plus debug XML
Select the file format used for saving photos. This affects \"standard\" (not RAW) photos. Note that PNG format is not truly lossless, instead it is converted from a JPEG at 100%% quality.\n%s

Select Camera2 API to enables extra feature such as manual modes for exposure, focus, white balance, along with RAW (if supported by the device), but may not work properly on all devices. Changing the API will cause a restart.\n%s

Take photo/video when a noise is detected, or on voice command. When enabled, use the on-screen microphone button to start/stop listening. Note the voice command option uses the Android speech recognition service: when using this option, audio data is likely to be sent to remote servers to perform speech recognition. \n%s

If possible, use an address when stamping GPS locations. This option requires an Internet connection. Note that if enabled, this requires that your device transmits location data across the Internet to a third party in order to convert GPS coordinates to an address. See https://developer.android.com/reference/android/location/Geocoder . \n%s

Touch to focus, and press the blue camera button to take photos. \n\nTo disable maximum screen brightness, see Settings/On screen GUI/\"Force maximum brightness\". To save to SD cards on Android 5+, see Settings/More camera controls/\"Use Storage Access Framework\". For more help, click \"Online help\" from Settings.

Open Camera accesses camera sensor and microphone data to fulfil its purpose as a camera. Microphone is also used for the optional "Audio control". 
Access to files is needed to save resultant photos and videos to your device. 
Location permission is required for the optional geotagging/stamp/subtitles and Bluetooth features. 
Since Open Camera also uses operating system APIs, you should review relevant privacy policies such as for your device, manufacturer, operating system and/or Google accounts. For example: 
*The optional voice control option uses the Android speech recognition service. When enabled, audio data is likely to be sent to remote servers by Android to perform speech recognition. 
*The "addresses" option for photo stamp or video subtitles uses the Android Geocoder API. When enabled, this requires that your device transmits location data across the Internet to a third party (which may depend on what "backend services" are installed on your device). 
*Apps/services such as cloud services on your device may auto-upload photos and videos that are saved on your device.
(Your audio may be sent to remote\n servers by Android to perform speech\n recognition.)
Open Camera is © 2013–2019 Mark Harman, released under the GPL v3 or later. Tap here for full licence text.

Open Camera uses icons from Google\'s Material Design icons (https://developer.android.com/design/downloads/index.html , https://design.google.com/icons/ , https://github.com/google/material-design-icons/ , https://google.github.io/material-design-icons/) under the Apache license version 2.0. Some icons include modifications. Tap here for full licence text.
Please tap here for full online licensing information (opens in your browser).

[This dialog is shown when Open Camera is updated. You can disable it under Settings/On screen GUI/Show What's New dialog.] 

v1.47.3:

Camera2 API option is now a "list" selection rather than a toggle switch. This option should be copied over, but just in case, if you had enabled Camera2 API and Camera2 features are no longer available, please check Settings/"Camera API".

Grids were being drawing too faintly.

Updated appearance of some icons.
